description: Developed and maintained a cross-platform temple booking app using React Native (Expo) and Next.js, improving reliability and user adoption.
Led key features like multi-day booking, role-based access, and set up shared logic for an upcoming product from scratch.
Delivered frontend for 10+ client projects—from startup sites to e-commerce tools—using modern stacks like Next.js, Zustand, and React Query.
Collaborated across teams for high-performance UIs and mentored interns while contributing to core architecture and reviews.

projects.name: Shuffle Glimpse
description: A web app made with the Spotify Web API to provide a glance into your listening habits.  Check out your favorite artists, songs, recently played, and saved songs.
Coded using modern technologies such as zustand, tanstack react-query, Cloudflare Worker and Next.js. With a modern, clean, Spotify-like UI.

projects.name: Blood Donors
description: A mobile app created for a public welfare organization, a group of people who make urgent donations.  This software keeps track of blood donors' records and donation histories, as well as maintaining an up-to-date list monitored by enrolled staff.
Crafted with powerful Expo + Supabase combo.

projects.name: Pomtick
description: The timer that makes you tick! Pomtick is a multi-platform pomodoro timer with a classy themeable interface.
Managed using turborepo, a monorepo manager. It has a web app (Next.js) and a native app (Tauri) for Windows, Linux & MacOs.

projects.name: Personal Website v2
description: A portfolio website. It offers a visually appealing fancy UI with an awesome loading animation!
The majority of the scripts are written in vanilla js, with styling done mostly in CSS. Another attracting feature of this website is the page transition effect.

projects.name: Movie Loft
description: Movie Loft is a simple to use web-based movie database client. It could be useful when looking for movies and television shows. It also contains detailed information on a film or television show, such as the cast and crew, number of episodes, and so on.
Notably, it was a beginner-friendly project for learning open APIs and api integeration.

projects.name: Drum Kit
description: A basic and easy-to-create yet entertaining website that simulates a drum kit.
Created with vanilla js and some audio clips powered with keybindings

projects.name: JS Calculator
description: A calculator with a real calculator appearance! Under the hood, it is a basic algorithm powered by vanilla javascript.

projects.name: React Todo
description: Simple React Todo app with a simple design. It can obviously add, list, checkmark, and delete your tasks, but it does so in a simple manner.
